revised_title: The Impact of Internal Tetramethylammonium Ions on Sodium Channel Open States in Squid Giant Axon
tldr: This study investigates the effect of internal tetramethylammonium ions on the open states of sodium channels in squid giant axons. The researchers found that these ions have a dual effect on the open states, which can be crucial for understanding the functioning of nerve cells and the potential development of new treatments for neurological disorders.
